title: Research 2026 Rust agent crates for ion
description: Validate claims about rig, mcp-rust/gemini-mcp, rs-graph-llm, similar, rnk; compare alternatives and recommend stack fit for ion.

logs.msg: Verified Rig remains active (0xPlaygrounds/rig); supports provider integrations + agent/tool abstractions and vector-store integrations; README warns 'here be dragons' / potential breaking changes.

MCP ecosystem check: official modelcontextprotocol/rust-sdk uses rmcp crate; current ion uses mcp-sdk-rs 0.3.4 (custom integration in src/mcp/mod.rs). mcp-sdk-rs README/docs still marked WIP, making rmcp likely stronger long-term target.

rs-graph-llm maps to graph-flow crate, but published storage backends are InMemory + Postgres (no stated SQLite/Turso). Ion already has SQLite session persistence + custom compaction + similar-based diffing; recommendation is incremental MCP migration and optional adapter experimentation, not framework rewrite.
